snippet: The fumbled rollout of the health care law has forced candidates, including three congressional incumbents in New Hampshire, to balance their loyalty to the White House with the needs of an angry constituency.
abstract: Democrats across the country, who were emboldened by voter fury over Republican shutdown of federal government, find themselves on the defensive in wake of fumbled rollout of health care law; faltering law has forced candidates, including New Hampshire incumbents Reps Carol Shea-Porter and Ann McLane Custer and Sen Jeanne Shaheen, to balance their loyalty to Pres Obama with the needs of an angry constituency.

byline.contributor: Ashley Parker and Robert Pear contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The fumbled rollout of the health care law has forced candidates, including three congressional incumbents in New Hampshire, to balance their loyalty to the White House with the needs of an angry constituency.

headline.main: In Fracas on Health Coverage, Some Democrats Feel Exposed
headline.print_headline: In Fracas on Health Coverage, Some Democrats Feel Exposed

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
